sn4.22:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Sakyans at Silāvatī .
sn4.22:1.2: Now on that occasion the Venerable Samiddhi was dwelling not far from the Blessed One—diligent, ardent, and resolute.
sn4.22:1.3: Then, while the Venerable Samiddhi was alone in seclusion, a reflection arose in his mind thus:
sn4.22:1.4: “It is indeed a gain for me, it is well gained by me,
sn4.22:1.5: that my teacher is the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One!
sn4.22:1.6: It is indeed a gain for me, it is well gained by me,
sn4.22:1.7: that I have gone forth in this well-expounded Dhamma and Discipline!
sn4.22:1.8: It is indeed a gain for me, it is well gained by me,
sn4.22:1.9: that my companions in the holy life are virtuous, of good character!”
sn4.22:1.10: Then Māra the Evil One, having known with his own mind the reflection in the mind of the Venerable Samiddhi, approached him and, not far from him, made a loud noise, frightful and terrifying, as though the earth were splitting open.
sn4.22:2.1: Then the Venerable Samiddhi approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and reported what had happened.
sn4.22:3.1: ] “That was not the earth splitting open, Samiddhi.
sn4.22:3.2: That was Māra the Evil One, who had come in order to confound you.
sn4.22:3.3: Go back, Samiddhi, and dwell diligent, ardent, and resolute. ”
sn4.22:3.4: “Yes, venerable sir, ” the Venerable Samiddhi replied. Then he rose from his seat, paid homage to the Blessed One, and departed, keeping him on the right.
sn4.22:3.5: A second time, while the Venerable Samiddhi was alone in seclusion,
sn4.22:3.6: a reflection arose in his mind …
sn4.22:3.7: And a second time Māra the Evil One …
sn4.22:3.8: made a loud noise, frightful and terrifying, as though the earth were splitting open.
sn4.22:3.9: Then the Venerable Samiddhi, having understood, “This is Māra the Evil One, ” addressed him in verse:
sn4.22:4.1: “I have gone forth out of faith
sn4.22:4.2: From the home to the homeless life.
sn4.22:4.3: My mindfulness and wisdom are mature,
sn4.22:4.5: Conjure up whatever forms you wish,
sn4.22:4.6: But you will never make me tremble. ”
sn4.22:5.1: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The bhikkhu Samiddhi knows me, ” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
